gaia::core::Widget Class Reference

Private Member Functions

 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (Widget)

Detailed Description

The Widget class is the base class of all user interface component.

Using Widget

Drawing

Drawing is performed by traversal the widget tree.
To foce a widget to draw, call refresh().

Definition at line 136 of file Widget.h.

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
OVER_SCROLL_ALWAYS 

Always allow a user to over-scroll this widget, provided it is a widget that can scroll.

See also:
getOverScrollMode()
setOverScrollMode(int32_t)
OVER_SCROLL_IF_CONTENT_SCROLLS 

Allow a user to over-scroll this widget only if the content is large enough to meaningfully scroll, provided it is a widget that can scroll.

See also:
getOverScrollMode()
setOverScrollMode(int32_t)
OVER_SCROLL_NEVER 

Never allow a user to over-scroll this widget.

See also:
getOverScrollMode()
setOverScrollMode(int32_t)

Member Function Documentation

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::bringToFront ( ) [virtual]

Change the widget item's z order in the tree, so it's on top of other sibling widget items.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::buildDrawingCache ( bool  autoScale) [virtual]

Forces the drawing cache to be built.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::cancelLongPress ( ) [virtual]

Cancels a pending long press.

Your subclass can use this if you want the context menu to come up if the user presses and holds at the same place, but you don't want it to come up if they press and then move around enough to cause scrolling.

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::TextWidget.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::clearAnimation ( ) [virtual]

Cancels any animations for this widget item.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::clearFocus ( ) [virtual]

Called when this widget wants to give up focus.

This will cause onFocusChanged to be called.

virtual int32_t gaia::core::Widget::computeHorizontalScrollExtent ( ) [virtual]

Compute the horizontal extent of the horizontal scrollbar's thumb within the horizontal range.

This value is used to compute the length of the thumb within the scrollbar's track. The range is expressed in arbitrary units that must be the same as the units used by computeHorizontalScrollRange() and computeHorizontalScrollOffset(). The default extent is the drawing width of this widget.

Returns:
the horizontal extent of the scrollbar's thumb

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::AbsListWidget.

virtual int32_t gaia::core::Widget::computeHorizontalScrollOffset ( ) [virtual]

Compute the horizontal offset of the horizontal scrollbar's thumb within the horizontal range.

This value is used to compute the position of the thumb within the scrollbar's track. The range is expressed in arbitrary units that must be the same as the units used by computeHorizontalScrollRange() and computeHorizontalScrollExtent(). The default offset is the scroll offset of this widget.

Returns:
the horizontal offset of the scrollbar's thumb

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::AbsListWidget, and gaia::webkit::WebView.

virtual int32_t gaia::core::Widget::computeHorizontalScrollRange ( ) [virtual]

Compute the horizontal range that the horizontal scrollbar represents.

The range is expressed in arbitrary units that must be the same as the units used by computeHorizontalScrollExtent() and computeHorizontalScrollOffset(). The default range is the drawing width of this widget.

Returns:
the total horizontal range represented by the horizontal scrollbar

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::AbsListWidget, and gaia::webkit::WebView.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::computeScroll ( ) [virtual]

Called by a parent to request that a child update its values for mScrollX and mScrollY if necessary.

This will typically be done if the child is animating a scroll.

Reimplemented in gaia::webkit::WebView, and gaia::ui::TextWidget.

virtual int32_t gaia::core::Widget::computeVerticalScrollExtent ( ) [virtual]

Compute the vertical extent of the horizontal scrollbar's thumb within the vertical range.

This value is used to compute the length of the thumb within the scrollbar's track. The range is expressed in arbitrary units that must be the same as the units used by computeVerticalScrollRange() and computeVerticalScrollOffset(). The default extent is the drawing height of this widget.

Returns:
the vertical extent of the scrollbar's thumb

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::AbsListWidget, gaia::webkit::WebView, and gaia::ui::GridWidget.

virtual int32_t gaia::core::Widget::computeVerticalScrollOffset ( ) [virtual]

Compute the vertical offset of the vertical scrollbar's thumb within the horizontal range.

This value is used to compute the position of the thumb within the scrollbar's track. The range is expressed in arbitrary units that must be the same as the units used by computeVerticalScrollRange() and computeVerticalScrollExtent(). The default offset is the scroll offset of this widget.

Returns:
the vertical offset of the scrollbar's thumb

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::AbsListWidget, gaia::webkit::WebView, and gaia::ui::GridWidget.

virtual int32_t gaia::core::Widget::computeVerticalScrollRange ( ) [virtual]

Compute the vertical range that the vertical scrollbar represents.

The range is expressed in arbitrary units that must be the same as the units used by computeVerticalScrollExtent() and computeVerticalScrollOffset().

Returns:
the total vertical range represented by the vertical scrollbar The default range is the drawing height of this widget.

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::AbsListWidget, gaia::webkit::WebView, and gaia::ui::GridWidget.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::destroyDrawingCache ( ) [virtual]

Frees the resources used by the drawing cache.

If you call buildDrawingCache() manually without calling setDrawingCacheEnabled(true), you should cleanup the cache with this method afterwards.

virtual bool gaia::core::Widget::hasFocusable ( ) [virtual]

Returns true if this widget is focusable or if it contains a reachable widget for which hasFocusable() returns true.

A "reachable hasFocusable()" is a widget whose parents do not block descendants focus.

Only VISIBLE widgets are considered focusable.

void gaia::core::Widget::layout ( int32_t  l,
int32_t  t,
int32_t  r,
int32_t  b 
)

Assign a size and position to a widget and all of its descendants.

This is the second phase of the layout mechanism. (The first is measuring). In this phase, each parent calls layout on all of its children to position them. This is typically done using the child measurements that were stored in the measure pass().

Derived classes with children should override onLayout. In that method, they should call layout on each of their their children.

Parameters:
lLeft position, relative to parent
tTop position, relative to parent
rRight position, relative to parent
bBottom position, relative to parent
void gaia::core::Widget::measure ( int32_t  widthMeasureSpec,
int32_t  heightMeasureSpec 
)

This is called to find out how big a widget should be.

The parent supplies constraint information in the width and height parameters. The actual mesurement work of a widget is performed in onMeasure(int32_t, int32_t), called by this method. Therefore, only onMeasure(int32_t, int32_t) can and must be overriden by subclasses.

Parameters:
widthMeasureSpecHorizontal space requirements as imposed by the parent
heightMeasureSpecVertical space requirements as imposed by the parent
See also:
onMeasure(int32_t, int32_t)

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::onAttachedToWindow ( ) [virtual]

This is called when the widget is attached to a window.

At this point it has a Surface and will start drawing. Note that this function is guaranteed to be called before onDraw(const gaia::graphics::Canvas&), however it may be called any time before the first onDraw -- including before or after onMeasure(int32_t, int32_t).

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::AbsListWidget.

virtual bool gaia::core::Widget::onCheckIsTextEditor ( ) [virtual]

Check whether the called widget is a text editor, in which case it would make sense to automatically display a soft input window for it.

Subclasses should override this if they implement onCreateInputConnection(EditorInfo) to return true if a call on that method would return a non-null InputConnection, and they are really a first-class editor that the user would normally start typing on when the go into a window containing your widget.

The default implementation always returns false. This does not mean that its onCreateInputConnection(EditorInfo) will not be called or the user can not otherwise perform edits on your widget; it is just a hint to the system that this is not the primary purpose of this widget.

Returns:
Returns true if this widget is a text editor, else false.
virtual void gaia::core::Widget::onConfigurationChanged ( const gaia::content::Configuration *  newConfig) [virtual]

Called when the current configuration of the resources being used by the application have changed.

You can use this to decide when to reload resources that can changed based on orientation and other configuration characterstics. You only need to use this if you are not relying on the normal mechanism of recreating the page instance upon a configuration change.

Parameters:
newConfigThe new resource configuration.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::onWindowFocusChanged ( bool  hasWindowFocus) [virtual]

Called when the window containing this widget gains or loses focus.

Note that this is separate from widget focus: to receive key events, both your widget and its window must have focus. If a window is displayed on top of yours that takes input focus, then your own window will lose focus but the widget focus will remain unchanged.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setActivated ( bool  activated) [virtual]

Changes the activated state of this widget.

A widget can be activated or not. Note that activation is not the same as selection. Selection is a transient property, representing the widget (hierarchy) the user is currently interacting with. Activation is a longer-term state that the user can move widgets in and out of. For example, in a list widget with single or multiple selection enabled, the widgets in the current selection set are activated. (Um, yeah, we are deeply sorry about the terminology here.) The activated state is propagated down to children of the widget it is set on.

Parameters:
activatedtrue if the widget must be activated, false otherwise
virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setAlpha ( float  alpha) [virtual]

Sets the opacity of the widget item.

(not yet implement)

This is a value from 0 to 1, where 0 means the widget item is completely transparent and 1 means the widget item is completely opaque.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setAnimation ( const Animation *  animation) [virtual]

Sets the next animation to play for this widget.

If you want the animation to play immediately, use startAnimation. This method provides allows fine-grained control over the start time and invalidation, but you must make sure that 1) the animation has a start time set, and the widget's parent (which controls animations on its children) will be invalidated when the animation is supposed to start.

Parameters:
animationThe next animation, or null.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setLayerType ( int32_t  layerType,
const gaia::graphics::Paint *  paint 
) [virtual]

Specifies the type of layer backing this widget. The layer can be disabled, software or hardware.

A layer is associated with an optional Paint instance that controls how the layer is composed on screen. The following properties of the paint are taken into account when composing the layer:

  • {graphics.Paint::getAlpha() Translucency (alpha)}
  • {graphics.Paint::getXfermode() Blending mode}
  • {graphics.Paint::getColorFilter() Color filter}

If this widget has an alpha value set to < 1.0 by calling setAlpha(float), the alpha value of the layer's paint is replaced by this widget's alpha value. Calling setAlpha(float) is therefore equivalent to setting a hardware layer on this widget and providing a paint with the desired alpha value.

Refer to the documentation of disabled, software and hardware for more information on when and how to use layers.

Parameters:
layerTypeThe ype of layer to use with this widget, must be one of LAYER_TYPE_NONE, LAYER_TYPE_SOFTWARE or LAYER_TYPE_HARDWARE
paintThe paint used to compose the layer. This argument is optional and can be null. It is ignored when the layer type is LAYER_TYPE_NONE
See also:
getLayerType()
LAYER_TYPE_NONE
LAYER_TYPE_SOFTWARE
LAYER_TYPE_HARDWARE
setAlpha(float)

void gaia::core::Widget::setOverScrollMode ( int32_t  overScrollMode)

Set the over-scroll mode for this widget.

Valid over-scroll modes are OVER_SCROLL_ALWAYS (default), OVER_SCROLL_IF_CONTENT_SCROLLS (allow over-scrolling only if the widget content is larger than the container), or OVER_SCROLL_NEVER.

Setting the over-scroll mode of a widget will have an effect only if the widget is capable of scrolling.

Parameters:
overScrollModeThe new over-scroll mode for this widget.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setWillNotCacheDrawing ( bool  willNotCacheDrawing) [virtual]

When a widget's drawing cache is enabled, drawing is redirected to an offscreen bitmap.

Some widget, like an ImageWidget, must be able to bypass this mechanism if they already draw a single bitmap, to avoid unnecessary usage of the memory.

Parameters:
willNotCacheDrawingtrue if this widget does not cache its drawing, false otherwise
virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setWillNotDraw ( bool  willNotDraw) [virtual]

If this widget doesn't do any drawing on its own, set this flag to allow further optimizations.

By default, this flag is not set on widget, but could be set on some widget subclasses such as WidgetController.

Typically, if you override onDraw you should clear this flag.

Parameters:
willNotDrawwhether or not this widget draw on its own

bool gaia::core::Widget::startDrag ( const gaia::content::ClipData *  data,
const gaia::core::DragShadowBuilder *  shadowBuilder,
const Widget *  myLocalState,
int32_t  flags 
)

Starts a drag and drop operation.

When your application calls this method, it passes a DragShadowBuilder object to the system. Once the system has the drag shadow, it begins the drag and drop operation by sending drag events to all the widget objects in your application that are currently visible. It does this either by calling the widget object's drag listener (an implementation of onDrag() or by calling the widget object's onDragEvent() method. Both are passed a DragEvent object that has a DragEvent#getAction() value of DragEvent#ACTION_DRAG_STARTED.

Your application can invoke startDrag() on any attached widget object. The widget object does not need to be the one used in DragShadowBuilder, nor does it need to be related to the widget the user selected for dragging.

Parameters:
dataA ClipData object pointing to the data to be transferred by the drag and drop operation.
shadowBuilderA DragShadowBuilder object for building the drag shadow.
myLocalStateAn object containing local data about the drag and drop operation. This Object is put into every DragEvent object sent by the system during the current drag.

myLocalState is a lightweight mechanism for the sending information from the dragged widget to the target widgets. For example, it can contain flags that differentiate between a a copy operation and a move operation.

Parameters:
flagsFlags that control the drag and drop operation. No flags are currently defined, so the parameter should be set to 0.
Returns:
 true
if the method completes successfully, or 
 false
if it fails anywhere. Returning 
 false
means the system was unable to do a drag, and so no drag operation is in progress.
void gaia::core::Widget::stopAnimation ( )
Deprecated:
. Use ClearAnimation instead.
virtual bool gaia::core::Widget::verifyDrawer ( const gaia::graphics::Drawer *  who) [virtual]

If your widget subclass is displaying its own Drawer objects, it should override this function and return true for any Drawer it is displaying.

This allows animations for those drawers to be scheduled.

Be sure to call through to the super class when overriding this function.

Parameters:
whoThe Drawer to verify. Return true if it is one you are displaying, else return the result of calling through to the super class.
Returns:
bool If true than the Drawer is being displayed in the widget; else false and it is not allowed to animate.
